security: Revealing the upcoming presence of a purported CIA agent, especially a Cuban counter-espionage chief like Fabian Escalante, at a public conference could expose the agent's identity and potentially compromise ongoing or future intelligence operations. The cable's mention of "CIA AGENT CUBAN COUNTER-ESPIONAGE CHIEF, FABIAN ((ESCALANTE)), JOHN NEWMAN" makes this risk very explicit.
summary: A cable reports on a Rio de Janeiro newspaper article about an upcoming conference on the JFK assassination, noting the anticipated presence of a purported CIA agent (Cuban counter-espionage chief, Fabian Escalante) and John Newman, among others.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET cable, originating from SAO PAULO on July 27, 1995, alerts the DIRECTOR, HAVANA, and BRASILIA to a Rio de Janeiro newspaper article advertising a forthcoming seminar on the JFK assassination sponsored by the Rio de Janeiro Regional Court. The article highlights that a U.S. person, the director of a research and documentation center on assassinations, as well as a purported CIA agent, Cuban counter-espionage chief Fabian Escalante, and John Newman are expected to attend.
title: Rio Conference on JFK Assassination to be Attended by CIA Agent Per Press Report
